Key Arguments: The legislation increases government power in a way that threatens freedom of speech, which is fundamental to democracy.
The government should not have the authority to decide what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
There is a concern that the legislation could lead to Orwellian control and suppression of differing views.
Past instances of alleged misinformation, such as claims about COVID-19 vaccines, were later proven true, highlighting the dangers of government-controlled truth.
The legislation could further erode trust in the government and democratic institutions.
The proposed powers resemble totalitarian control and could make Australia more like China in terms of social control.
Notable Quotes: Without freedom of speech THERE IS NO DEMOCRACY.
For me this is Orwellian and frightening.
This is an attempt at a type of totalitarian control.
I fear that the country I love, Australia, is trying to become more like China which socially controls its population.
